net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp

Class TcpHandshakeCon

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.StreamCon
      • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.StreamConReader
        • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp.TcpCon
          • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.tcp.TcpHandshakeCon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, InetCon, StreamConI, MsgParsable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GroupServerCon

    public class TcpHandshakeCon
extends TcpCon
    An internet connection with the local and remote id's synched with the remote connection. Before a new TcpHandshakeCon object is fully constructed, it sends its local id across the socket and waits to receive the remote connection's local id. A StreamGreeter object is used to achieve the passing of local id's. After the TcpHandshakeCon object is successfully constructed, calling getId() will equal getLocalId() on the remote connection, and vice versa.

    The remote connection must also be TcpHandshakeCon or must use the StreamGreeter when the socket is first created.

    Since:
    1.0

               long localId)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       HandshakeFailedException
        Constructs a new TcpHandshakeCon object with the given socket.
        Parameters:
        s - socket to use
        localId - the local id of the connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • TcpHandshakeCon

        public TcpHandshakeCon(java.net.Socket s,
               long localId,
               long handshakeTimeout)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       HandshakeFailedException
        Constructs a new TcpHandshakeCon object with the given socket.
        Parameters:
        s - socket to use
        localId - the local id of the connection
        handshakeTimeout - the amount of time to wait for the remote connection to send it's local id
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        HandshakeFailedException - if the exchanging of id's fails
